intro: Lastrea leptorachis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often ornamental species. The plant features cylindrical, ribbed stems that are typically green with a slight bluish tinge. Its small, clustered flowers are usually yellow or orange, blooming in late spring or early summer. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems.
